# Bunge Global (BG) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Bunge Global SA operates as an agribusiness and food company worldwide, operating through four segments: Agribusiness, Refined and Specialty Oils, Milling, and Sugar and Bioenergy. The Agribusiness segment purchases, stores, transports, processes, and sells agricultural commodities and commodity products, including oilseeds primarily soybeans, rapeseed, canola, and sunflower seeds, as well as grains comprising wheat and corn; and processes oilseeds into vegetable oils and protein meals. 

Bunge Global SA is a global agribusiness and food company, incorporated in Geneva, Switzerland and headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri, United States. As well as being an international soybean exporter, it is also involved in food processing, grain trading, and fertilizer. The company has approximately 23,000 employees in 40 countries. Bunge is the world's largest oilseed processor, the world's number one seller of bottled vegetable oil to consumers and the largest producer and supplier of fertilizers to farmers in South America.

As a premier agribusiness solutions provider, our team of ~37,000 dedicated employees partner with farmers across the globe to move agricultural commodities from where they're grown to where they're needed—in faster, smarter, and more efficient ways. We are a world leader in grain origination, storage, distribution, oilseed processing and refining, offering a broad portfolio of plant-based oils, fats, and proteins. We work alongside our customers at both ends of the value chain to deliver quality products and develop tailored, innovative solutions that address evolving consumer needs. With 200+ years of experience and presence in over 50 countries, we are committed to strengthening global food security, advancing sustainability, and helping communities prosper where we operate.

## 2. Current Market Data

The current price of BG is 107.81 USD — it has decreased by −0.94% in the past 24 hours. Bunge Global (BG) shows strong momentum with a 15.34% increase over the past quarter and a new dividend of $0.70 per share. The Bunge Global SA 52-week high stock price is 100.12, which is 0.1% above the current share price. The Bunge Global SA 52-week low stock price is 67.40, which is 32.6% below the current share price. The average Bunge Global SA stock price for the last 52 weeks is 82.01. A market capitalization between $10 billion and $200 billion places BG in the large capitalization category.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

**Agribusiness Segment:**
The Agribusiness segment purchases, stores, transports, processes, and sells agricultural commodities and commodity products, including oilseeds primarily soybeans, rapeseed, canola, and sunflower seeds, as well as grains comprising wheat and corn; and processes oilseeds into vegetable oils and protein meals. This segment offers its products for animal feed manufacturers, livestock producers, wheat and corn millers, and other oilseed processors, as well as third-party edible oil processing and biofuel companies for biofuel production.

**Refined and Specialty Oils Segment:**
The Refined and Specialty Oils segment sells packaged and bulk oils and fats that comprise cooking oils, shortenings, margarines, mayonnaise, renewable diesel feedstocks, and other products for baked goods companies, snack food producers, confectioners, restaurant chains, foodservice operators, infant nutrition companies, and other food manufacturers, as well as grocery chains, wholesalers, distributors, and other retailers. This segment also refines and fractionates palm oil, palm kernel oil, coconut oil, and shea butter, and olive oil; and produces specialty ingredients derived from vegetable oils, such as lecithin.

**Milling Segment:**
The Milling segment provides wheat flours and bakery mixes; corn milling products that comprise dry-milled corn meals and flours, wet-milled masa and flours, and flaking and brewer's grits, as well as soy-fortified corn meal, corn-soy blends, and other products; whole grain and fiber ingredients; die-cut pellets; and non-GMO products.

**Processing Capacity Distribution:**
Approximately 36% of our processing capacity is located in South America, 26% in North America, 23% in Europe and 15% in Asia-Pacific.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**New Processing Facilities:**
We are celebrating today the approval of an investment decision to build a new oilseed processing plant located on the Gulf Coast in Destrehan, LA as part of Bunge Chevron Ag Renewables LLC, our JV with Chevron. The plant is adjacent to our existing processing facility and features a flexible design, intended to allow it to process soybeans as well as softseeds, including novel winter oilseed crops, such as winter canola and CoverCress, among others.

**International Expansion:**
Bunge is celebrating the opening of our new port-based multi-oil greenfield facility in Krishnapatnam, India... The new facility enables us to process sunflower oil for the first time to meet the fast-growing local demand.

**Renewable Energy Partnerships:**
We are pleased to announce another partnership in the renewable energy space! We signed an agreement to collaborate with the multi-energy company Repsol in the development of new opportunities to help meet the growing demand for lower carbon intensity feedstocks for the production of renewable fuels.

## 5. Growth Strategy

**Viterra Integration:**
Bunge Global SA today announced the successful closing of its previously announced merger with Viterra Limited, marking the creation of a premier global agribusiness solutions company for food, feed and fuel. Greg Heckman, Bunge's Chief Executive Officer, said: "Today is a defining moment for our company and our global team as we complete this transformative business combination... Together, we've formed a stronger organization with enhanced capabilities and expertise to meet the evolving needs of our customers, maximize value for our stakeholders and fulfill our shared purpose to connect farmers to consumers to deliver food, feed and fuel to the world."

**Strategic Benefits:**
With Bunge's and Viterra's highly complementary asset footprints, the combined company will be positioned to connect farmers in the world's largest production regions to areas with the fastest-growing consumption. Enhanced Ability to Meet the Demands of Increasingly Complex Markets: Better balance of value chains across geographies, access to more key origination markets and a diversified agriculture network covering all major crops will enhance the combined company's ability to provide solutions for end customers in any environment.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

This segment offers its products for animal feed manufacturers, livestock producers, wheat and corn millers, and other oilseed processors, as well as third-party edible oil processing and biofuel companies for biofuel production applications... for baked goods companies, snack food producers, confectioners, restaurant chains, foodservice operators, infant nutrition companies, and other food manufacturers, as well as grocery chains, wholesalers, distributors, and other retailers.

Bunge's products are used by livestock producers, animal feed manufacturers, snack food producers, wheat and corn millers, restaurant chains, food processing companies, bakery confectioners and corn and oilseed processors, among others.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results:**
fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales rose 71.6% year on year to $22.16 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.27 per share was 15.3% above analysts' consensus estimates.

Revenue: $22.16 billion vs analyst estimates of $25.56 billion (71.6% year-on-year growth, 13.3% miss) Adjusted EPS: $2.27 vs analyst estimates of $1.97 (15.3% beat) Adjusted EBITDA: $998 million vs analyst estimates of $840.4 million (4.5% margin, 18.8% beat) Adjusted EPS guidance for the full year is $7.45 at the midpoint, beating analyst estimates by 2.5%

**Annual Performance:**
With $60.11 billion in revenue over the past 12 months, Bunge Global is one of the most widely recognized consumer staples companies... This brings the company's revenue in the last twelve months to $60.11B, up 10.29% year-over-year.

**2025 Guidance:**
Taking into account the current margin and macro environment and forward curves as well as estimated third quarter results, Bunge expects full-year 2025 adjusted EPS in the range of approximately $7.30 to $7.60... Bunge Global SA continues to expect full-year 2025 adjusted EPS of $7.30 to $7.60, implying second-half adjusted EPS of $4.00 to $4.25.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Headwinds:**
- BG's weak performance is mainly due to pressures from cyclical commodities, geopolitical trade tensions, and integration challenges. Moreover, the tariffs China imposed on U.S. goods have hurt Bunge's revenue, especially in soybean trading.
- Dependency on commodity prices, making the company vulnerable to market fluctuations and price volatility. Limited presence in some emerging markets, which could hinder growth opportunities and market expansion.
- On 5 January 2026 a Bunge sunflower oil production plant in Dnipro, Ukraine, was hit in a Russian drone attack. Resulting in 300 tonnes of oil spilled onto roads. Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha claimed on 6 January 2026 that the attack was not accidental and he assessed that Russia was systematically attacking American businesses in Ukraine.

**Tailwinds:**
- Soy and sugar prices are expected to rise.
- Increasing global population and changing dietary patterns, driving demand for sustainable and nutritious food products.
- with the Viterra integration enhancing global operations and creating operational synergies.

## 9. Market Shares

**Global Market Position:**
ADM (Archer Daniels Midland), Bunge, Cargill, and Louis Dreyfus collectively control 50-60% of international trade in wheat, corn, and soybeans... Experts estimate that Cargill's turnover is 217 million tons, Bunge – 142 million tons, ADM – 100 million tons, Dreyfus – 83 million tons.

The Big Five control between 70 and 90 per cent of the global trade in commercial grains... Bunge and Cargill alone are responsible for more than 30 per cent of all soy exports from Brazil to Europe and dominate the French soybean meal market.

Bunge, according to globaldata.com, was the world's fifth-largest ag products company in terms of revenue as of 2021.

**Combined Operations with Viterra:**
Combined, the two companies have 125 crushing and refining facilities globally along with 55 port terminals and more than 350 grain storage facilities. The combined company would market more than 230 mmt of commodities and products.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

It competes with Archer Daniels Midland, Cargill and Louis Dreyfus. These competitors include Archer Daniels Midland (ADM), Cargill, and Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC). These companies are often collectively referred to as the 'ABCD' of agribusiness.

**Market Share Comparison:**
- Cargill, the highest earning of the four, earned a record $165 billion in revenue in 2022.
- Cargill is the world's largest agribusiness and the US' largest privately held corporation, with assets across agriculture and industry, including steel and transport. With an immense hold over production and distribution, Cargill arguably is the global food system.

**Competitive Positioning:**
Just 10 years ago, the share of these four companies in the global market was 70-90%, but they were pushed by new competitors, primarily by the Chinese giant Cofco International (CIL), which sold 127 million tons of grains, oilseeds, and fruits in 2022... The Big Four are fighting with new competitors, trying to absorb them, and expanding their business areas, including biofuels, edible oils, animal feed, and food products. Since 2021, Cargill and ADM have stepped up their acquisitions of competitors, with the largest deal being the purchase of Bunge by Viterra.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Major Viterra Acquisition (Completed July 2, 2025):**
The terms of the merger announced in 2023 includes Viterra shareholders receiving about 65.5 million shares of Bunge stock valued at around $6.2 billion along with about $2 billion in cash. As part of the deal, Bunge will assume $9.8 billion of Viterra debt. Additionally, Bunge announced plans to repurchase about $2 billion in Bunge stock.

**Divestitures:**
On Tuesday, Bunge also announced the closing of a sale of its dry corn and corn masa milling operations to Grain Craft. The sale includes Bunge facilities in Danville, Illinois; Worthington, Indiana; Crete, Nebraska; Red Oak, Iowa; Muleshoe, Texas; Atchison, Kansas; and Queretaro, Mexico.

**Joint Ventures:**
We are celebrating today the approval of an investment decision to build a new oilseed processing plant located on the Gulf Coast in Destrehan, LA as part of Bunge Chevron Ag Renewables LLC, our JV with Chevron.

## 12. Recent Developments

**Leadership Changes (December 2025):**
David Mattiske will step down as co-Chief Operating Officer on December 11, 2025. Julio Garros will become Chief Operating Officer effective December 12, 2025. On December 12, 2025, the company announced that David Mattiske will step down from his role as co-Chief Operating Officer to pursue other professional opportunities. He ceased to be an executive officer effective December 11, 2025 and will support an orderly transition of his responsibilities until his separation becomes effective on December 31, 2025.

**Analyst Upgrades:**
Jan 08, 2026 10:45am ET Bunge price target raised to $119 from $112 at BofA by TipRanks... Dec 16, 2025 5:20am ET Bunge upgraded to Overweight from Equal Weight at Morgan Stanley by TipRanks

**Q4 2025 Earnings Schedule:**
The company prepares for its Q4 earnings release on February 4, 2026, amid concerns about cash flow sustainability and share valuation.

**Governance Updates:**
Dec 19, 2025 5:03pm ET Bunge Global Reduces Share Capital and Updates Governance by TipRanks

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Current Analyst Sentiment:**
Analysts' consensus opinion on BG stock is reasonably bullish, with a "Moderate Buy" rating overall. Out of nine analysts covering the stock, six advise a "Strong Buy" rating, two give a "Hold," and one recommends a "Strong Sell." BG's average analyst price target is $89.78, indicating a potential upside of 10.9% from the current levels.

**Recent Price Targets:**
Bunge price target raised to $119 from $112 at BofA

**Valuation Concerns:**
BG is trading at a 183% premium.

**Fair Value Estimates:**
Uncover how Bunge Global's forecasts yield a $105.67 fair value, a 14% upside to its current price... Five fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St Community span a wide range from about US$79 to roughly US$438 per share, underscoring how differently individuals view Bunge's prospects.

**Investment Rating:** 7.2/10

**Rationale for Rating:**
- **Strong Operational Performance**: Q3 2025 earnings significantly exceeded expectations with adjusted EPS of $2.27 vs. consensus of $1.97
- **Strategic Transformation**: The Viterra integration completed in July 2025 creates the world's largest agribusiness network with enhanced global reach and synergies
- **Market Leadership Position**: Part of the ABCD oligopoly controlling 50-60% of global grain trade, with specific dominance in oilseed processing
- **Financial Strength**: $60.11B trailing twelve months revenue with strong EBITDA margins
- **Analyst Confidence**: Recent upgrades from Morgan Stanley and BofA with price targets raised to $119

**Risk Factors Limiting Higher Rating:**
- High commodity price volatility exposure
- Geopolitical risks (Ukraine facility attacked, China trade tensions)
- Premium valuation at 183% above fair value estimates
- Integration execution risks with Viterra merger
- Cyclical nature of agricultural commodities

**Estimated Fair Value:** $105-115 per share

Based on the comprehensive analysis, Bunge Global presents a compelling investment opportunity for growth-focused portfolios with moderate risk tolerance. The successful Viterra integration, strong operational performance, and dominant market position provide significant competitive advantages, though investors should be mindful of commodity volatility and geopolitical risks inherent in the agricultural sector.
tldr_summary:
Bunge Global SA is a leading agribusiness and food company that processes agricultural commodities, specializing in oilseed processing, grain trading, and food production across 40 countries. The company recently completed a transformative merger with Viterra, creating the world's largest agribusiness network with enhanced global operations spanning grain origination, processing, and distribution.

Key investment highlights include market leadership in the ABCD agricultural oligopoly, controlling 50-60% of global grain trade, and strategic expansion into renewable energy through partnerships with Chevron and Repsol. With a diversified portfolio across agribusiness, refined oils, milling, and bioenergy segments, Bunge demonstrates resilience through global market fluctuations and increasing demand for sustainable food solutions.

The AI investment rating of 7.2/10 suggests a "Moderate Buy" with a fair value estimate of $105-115 per share, reflecting strong operational performance and strategic growth potential balanced against commodity market volatility.
